Question_1.Question: What are the names of the three storage options on Google Cloud Platform?

Question_2.Question: What are the names of the six database options on Google Cloud Platform?

Question_3.Question: Of the six database options on Google Cloud Platform, which four are NoSQL?

Question_4.Question: Of the six database options on Google Cloud Platform, which option is SQL-based and which is relational (in that respective order)?

Question_5.Question: Given this graphic, identify the names of the storage or database service that each icon represents on Google Cloud Platform.

Question_6.Question: What is Cloud Storage?
Question_6.Option_1: [1] Consistent, scalable, large capacity, highly durable object storage
Question_6.Option_2: [2] Virtualized storage pools with unlimited capacity
Question_6.Option_3: [3] Hierarchical file system for distributed data
Question_6.Option_4: [4] High-performance block storage optimized for databases

Question_7.Question: What is the difference between Cloud Storage and Block Storage?
Question_7.Option_1: [1] Block Storage manages data at a more granular level and is what you would attach to your instance to store your OS, whereas Cloud Storage manages data as objects, such as documents or pictures
Question_7.Option_2: [2] Cloud Storage is optimized for high-performance databases, while Block Storage manages data as objects
Question_7.Option_3: [3] Block Storage is highly durable and scalable, while Cloud Storage is more suited for virtualized storage pools
Question_7.Option_4: [4] Cloud Storage is cost-effective and suitable for long-term data storage, while Block Storage manages data at a more granular level
Answers: Block Storage manages data at a more granular level and is what you would attach to your instance to store your OS, whereas Cloud Storage manages data as objects, such as documents or pictures.

Question_8.Question: Which of the following is a beneficial feature of Cloud Storage?
Question_8.Option_1: [1] Limited storage with a maximum object size
Question_8.Option_2: [2] Unlimited storage with a minimum object size
Question_8.Option_3: [3] Unlimited storage with no maximum object size
Question_8.Option_4: [4] Unlimited storage with no minimum object size
Answers: Unlimited storage with no minimum object size

Question_9.Question: Cloud Storage has how many 9's of Durability?

Question_10.Question: 11 9's Durability (99.99999999999%) addresses loss of files, where if you store 1 million files on Google Cloud Storage - statistically Google would lose one file every 659,000 thousand years [T/F]?

Question_11.Question: Which storage option would you attach to your instance to store your OS?
